title: faurschou.com font
content:
It's a font I've found in e-flux newsletter and I love it! I want to use it for a project.  
I don't know if it's an actual font or a modified existing font.  
Thanks for your help!

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [oct20\_faurschou\_img.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317162300/http:/typophile.com/files/oct20_faurschou_img.jpg) | 67.25 KB |
author: marbv

comments.content:
Inspecting the website with the [Whatfont app](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317162300/http:/chengyinliu.com/whatfont.html) the embedded font is called »gallerirobust«. So I assume it is a custom one.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317162300im_/http:/typophile.com/files/gallerirobust_5928.png)

[Houschka](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317162300/http:/www.identifont.com/show?4Y1) by Nick Cooke would be similar (and it comes without those annoying slab details)

Designed by [Kontrapunkt](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317162300/http:/www.kontrapunkt.com/news/new-responsive-website-faurschou-foundation). Renko's call of Houschka would surely provide a good base font, probably the closest one (/M to be tweaked). Mixing [Museo and Museo Sans](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317162300/http:/www.myfonts.com/search/museo) plus some little tweaking could work as well. [Proxima Nova](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317162300/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/marksimonson/proxima-nova) even if top rounded /A needs to be reconstructed would be another option.
